page.title: 03PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: Many tourists come to Crich to visit the{Stand}and the{Tramway Museum. In Crich there is an old building called the{Stockingers}Factory,however its real name is Royal Oak Cottages. Visitors come to see the continuous row of windows on the top floor where the framework knitting was done. The workers needed as much light as possible. In{Crich Market Place}is a row of 4 stone troughs,served with water from a natural spring.They were originally drinking troughs for animals. {Leahurst}at Holloway,a large house once the home of Florence Nightingale, is now a nursing home with 24 rooms. At{Wakebridge}there are disused lead workings and the site of a Manor House.
